entry.title: Just Flight Updates Fokker F28 Professional for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Just Flight has recently released the long-awaited 2.2 update for their Fokker F28 Professional for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and now 2024. The update brings cabin updates, native MSFS 2024 compatibility with pre-flight walkaround support, SimBrief flight plan uplink, and more. â While they prioritized making it Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024 nativeâallowing it to launch on the Marketplace for the first timeâthey also took the opportunity to improve the 2020 version, adding unique cabin branding for all the included liveries, with period-authentic touches, featuring some of the âboldâ design touches from the 1970s and 1980s. â The MSFS 2024 version also includes the pre-flight walkaround system, making it a native 2024 aircraft.Â â The EFB tablet model was revamped, offering a new mounting position (window-mounted), and the airplane now supports SimBrief flight plan uplinks, making the flight planning experience more seamless. The complete changelog follows below: v2.2 - Upgraded to a MSFS 2024 native package (MSFS 2024 only). - Added additional model LODs for improved performance (MSFS 2020/2024) and MSFS 2024 compatibility. - Added Preflight Walkaround support (MSFS 2024 only): Â Â Â Â - Chocks/Cones Â Â Â Â - GPU Â Â Â Â - Passenger and service doors (including airstairs handle, automatic/manual extension and jetway mode) Â Â Â Â - Cargo doors Â Â Â Â - Enter/exit aircraft - Added SimBrief OFP import functionality to UNS-1 FMS. - Added custom cabin textures to passenger liveries - Added new, modern EFB tablet model (tablet can now be moved between two positions by clicking the top/bottom bezels). - Added Jetway External Power logic - Default and GSX jetways, and GSX GPU, can now supply external power.Buttons on the EFB aircraft app allow for the selection of GPU or jetway power once available, or the overhead panel switch can be used as before. - Added 'AUTO CABIN MUSIC' option to the EFB, allowing you to control whether the cabin crew switch the cabin music on/off. - Added galley hot water handle animation. - Added support for third-party liveries to include livery configuration files. - Fixed EFB Charts and Map apps flickering (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed duplicated pilots appearing on exterior (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed missing copilot (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed copilot not animating with seat - Cockpit seat positions are now locked in MSFS 2024 due to simulator limitation that prevents the pilot characters from moving with them. - Fixed EFB OFP page formatting (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed user aircraft being detected by TCAS when using time compression. - Fixed MSFS 2024 payload initialisation issues when starting C&D (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed RMI dot/cross annunciator logic. - Fixed cockpit window seal flickering. - Fixed autopilot mode selector lighting brightness (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed preflight walkaround collision boxes â Itâs no longer possible to walk through parts of the aircraft when in preflight walkaround mode (MSFS 2024 only). - Fixed forward galley collision boxes â Itâs no longer possible to click through from cockpit to cabin and vice versa, preventing inadvertent selections, e.g. toggling a cockpit switch when trying to toggle a galley switch. - Fixed navigation light effects disappearing at distance (MSFS 2024) - Improved ASI bug logic - dragging of bugs is now possible, bugs interact with each other, and are more accurately set by speeds flipchart. - Improved EFB pushback functionality. - Improved cabin crew callouts triggers during taxi â âCabin Is Securedâ callout will now automatically trigger 5-8 minutes after the doors are closed, simulating the time it takes for a safety briefing and seat belt check. âCabin Crew Seats For Take-offâ logic remains the same, either triggered via the âCABIN CALLâ button on the overhead panel when the aircraft is in a take-off state, or automatically during the take-off run. - Improved Audio Selector Panel logic - Reworked for greater accuracy. - Improved Door 1L logic and animation - door up/down buttons are now functional, door can be pushed for manual extension, smoother airstairs animation, improved door/handle animation logic when triggered via EFB. - Moved ânavdataâ folder externally to the package to comply with MSFS 2024 SDK (Navigraph Hub has been updated to support the new location). - Updated Operations Manual - Updated EFB Manual - Updated UNS-1 Operations Manual â The add-on is available on their store for $55.99 (a temporary 20% discount due to the new update). The original retail price is $69.99. It requires at least 5.3 GB of free hard disk space to install. If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! â

entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SimulaciÃ³n Extrema has recently released their rendition of Tanegashima Airport (RJFG) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves the town of Nakatane on Tanegashima Island in Japan and has a yearly average of 74,633 passengers. It was built roughly 19 years ago to replace the original Tanegashima Airport, which was deemed unsuitable for jet aircraft and geographically impossible to expand from its original length (1500 meters). entry.title: GotFriends Releases Aeroprakt A-32 Vixxen for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. GotFriends recently released their rendition of the Aeroprakt A-32 Vixxen, a Ukrainian two-seat ultralight aircraft first flown in 2014, for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The A-32 is built upon the A-22 Foxbat, bringing several improvements and with one significant difference: unlike its âfatherâ, which could be purchased in kit form or fully assembled, it is only available as a kit in the United Kingdom, whereas you can get a factory-built version in 31 other nations. Itâs powered by a 100hp Rotax 912ULS engine, allowing it to cruise at 213 km/h with around 4.5 hours of total endurance, carrying only one person. The first prototype was completed in January 2014, and the first production aircraft was showcased in April 2015. The A-32 is still in production today. The add-on features an accurate rendition of the aircraft, featuring a high-detail 3D model, a comprehensive EFB, two flight deck configurations (standard six-pack, glass), and much more. Itâs available on Contrail for roughly $25, requiring at least 2.83 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Aerosoft Publishes A340-600 Development Update for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Aerosoft has published another A340-600Â development update in conjunction with ToLiss Simulation Software, which handles the intricate systems of the long-awaited aircraft. This weekâs update goes in depth about the aircraftâs fuel and electric systems and how they differ from the rest of the A320 family due to the extra two engines and the many challenges that come with it, such as the necessity for a fuel transfer system that gets in action during take-off and landing to ensure the center of gravity is within a safe zone. While the fuel transfer isnât visually demonstrated, it is described by Torsten - ToLiSS founder and CEO -, where it kicks in at different times throughout the flight, especially during the take-off roll and landing to ensure the center of gravity is balanced correctly, and ensuring it also accompanies its respective ECAM message, both for when it starts and for when itâs done transferring. After the halfway mark, they also cover part of the electrics and how they differ from the rest of the family, like the A340 having four generators rather than twoâas it is one per engineâoffering extra redundancy, and how the APU got its very own battery, just like the A330, so that it doesnât drain the other batteries when handling the APU startup. There is no release date or pricing yet, but Threshold will keep you informed. If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! â

entry.title: LevelUp Teases 737NG V2 Sound Overhaul for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. LevelUp has recently previewed its new FMOD 2.0 soundscape for the upcoming 737NG V2 in X-Plane 12, sharing an eleven-minute video on YouTube, giving more insight into the upcoming rework.Â Now included are separate, standalone interior and exterior soundsets, refreshed cabin ambience, and fixed avionics and wind noise. entry.title: FlyingArt Updates Cabby AI Plugin for MSFS and X-Plane

entry.title: Miltech Simulations Shares October Progress Update
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Miltech Simulations has recently published its October development blog, outlining progress across several of its big projects, including updates for the MH-60, Mission Hub, and Skyraider. New details on the U-2 Spyplane and CH-53 have also been shared. Miltech confirmed plans to gradually phase out MSFS 2020 development by 2026, citing the majority of users having already moved to MSFS 2024.Â The MH-60, developed in partnership with Blackbird Simulations, remains one of Miltechâs flagship aircraft, and recently joined the Marketplaceâs Top-Rated Aircraft Sale.Â A major v1.0.3 update is on the way, featuring an overhaul ofÂ APU logic, improved flight model and SAS behaviour, and AFCS refinements.Â The patch also introduces optional realistic INS alignment, new keybind support, and pop-out gauge functionality for multi-monitor setups.Â In addition, the first Livery Pack is nearly complete, adding a nice selection of military and rescue variants from the US Navy, 160th SOAR, and other international operators. Meanwhile, the Miltech Mission Hub is preparing for its long-awaited Xbox release, with both MSFS 2020 and 2024 versions in final testing.Â The update introduces sling load enhancements, a distance measuring tool, new SAR scenarios, and expanded SimObjects including vehicles, ships, and rescue assets.Â A Mission Builder App is also in development, allowing players to upload and share missions directly from the cloud. The upcoming Skyraider, also developed with Blackbird Simulations, has entered beta testing and is described as feature-complete for MSFS 2020, with a full conversion to the modular MSFS 2024 framework.Â Miltech said that the project will include multiple variants, including the A-1H, AD-3W, AEW.1, and AD-4W, each tied to specific liveries. Pricing is expected to land in the mid-$20 USD range, covering all variants, and the aircraft will support both PC and Xbox platforms at launch. Also in active development is the U-2, a passion project that originally began in early 2023. Miltech is building both S (digital) and R (analogue) variants, with complex avionics systems, new ground equipment, and fully modelled chase cars.Â The aircraft will come with five detailed airbases,Â including Groom Lake (Area 51), Fairford, and Akrotiri, and will feature dynamic missions built for Mission Hub.Â While no release window has been given, the developer notes that additional resources have been dedicated to bringing the project up to modern standards. Rounding out the lengthy blog, Miltech provided a brief look at the CH-53, showcasing its intricate rotor hub and configurable cabin layouts.Â Both the CH-53E and MH-53E variants are in progress, leveraging MSFS 2024âs modular framework for high detail and performance efficiency. entry.title: Black Square Releases Beechcraft Baron & Bonanza Bundle for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Black Square has recently released an aircraft bundle with the Beechcraft Baron and Bonanza for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. Unlike their earlier steam gauge overhaul add-ons, this bundle features its own 3D models and custom sounds.Â The bundle brings one of the most technically advanced simulations for Microsoft Flight Simulator (according to the developer), with an intricate reciprocating engine simulation, over a hundred possible failures, 12 hot-swappable radio configurations, and a custom turbocharger, pressurization, and cabin temperature simulation.Â Furthermore, Black Squareâs new Electronic Flight Bag allows you to configure the aircraft, manage payload and failures, monitor engines, electric schematics, and more. On top of that, the custom failure system features persistent wear, MTBF, and scheduled failures for nearly every component in the aircraft, and the tridimensional gauges are subject to the laws of physics, meaning they can become stuck and require tapping on the glass to become unstuck again. In the navigation department, there are multiple navigation suites to choose from, ranging from various eras of both planesâ long history: from a humble no-GPS Bendix-King RNAV system to a modern Garmin GTN 650/750 (PMS or TDS), a slightly humbler GNS 530/430 combo, or the classic KLN 90-B. It also features the KFC 150 autopilot, the RDR1150XL weather radar, and more. The Beechcraft Baron set includes three distinct airframes: the normally aspirated B58, the B58TC, and the B58P. The latter is from the early 2000s, and the former two are from the 1980s. It also accompanies six different interiors and nine different liveries. On the other hand, the Bonanza set also includes three variations: the A36, the A36TC with an aftermarket turbo-normalising package, and the B36TP turboprop conversion. Similarly, it also sports six interiors and nine liveries. Overall, the package includes an entirely custom exterior model, a custom sound pack from Boris Audio Works, higher-quality materials, fine-tuned performance tables, more avionics options, and much more. The bundle is available on the Just Flight store for roughly $64.99, requiring at least 3.9 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Carenado Teases B390 IA for MSFS 2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Carenado has recently teased the development and imminent release of a B390 IA rendition for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024, a light business jet designed and manufactured by Beechcraft. â The Beechcraft B-390 Premier IA was an updated version of the Premier 1, which was designed in the mid-90s, first flown in 1998, and certified in 2001.
